column1: This report provides the electricity highlights for the quarter regarding generation, demand and cost.
Report creation date and time in EST.
The report will be published four times a year with publishing on the first day of the next month after the end of the quarter.

1. Data includes output of all transmission-connected generation facilities and embedded generators that are Market Participants. Data does not include output of embedded generators that are not registered as Market Participants.
2. Oil facilities are included under the Gas category.
3. Coal generation ceased production in Q1 2014.
4. Transmission-connected solar began to be recorded in Q1 2015.
5. Values may not add up to the total due to rounding.
6. Related reports can be found at http://reports.ieso.ca/public/GenOutputbyFuelMonthly

1. Data includes output of all transmission-connected generation facilities and embedded generators that are Market Participants. Data does not include output of embedded generators that are not registered as Market Participants.
2. Oil facilities are included under the Gas category.

4. Transmission-connected solar began to be recorded in Q1 2015.
5. Percentages are based on GWh values.
6. Related reports can be found at http://reports.ieso.ca/public/GenOutputbyFuelMonthly

1. Data includes output of all transmission-connected generation facilities and embedded generators that are Market Participants. Data does not include output of embedded generators that are not registered as Market Participants.
2. Oil facilities are included under the Gas category.
3. Coal generation ceased production in Q1 2014.
4. Transmission-connected solar began to be recorded in Q1 2015.

1. Values may not add up to the total due to rounding.
2. Related reports can be found at http://reports.ieso.ca/public/IntertieScheduleFlowYear
Note: Numbers may not add up to totals due to rounding.
* Installed grid-connected generation capacity is the sum of all market participant generators who supply or bid into the IESO-administered market.  Numbers may not add up to totals due to rounding.
1 Units that use natural gas, oil or are dual fuel, such as Lennox, NP Kirkland and NP Cochrane, are included in the Gas category.
Contracted Embedded Generation Capacity in Commercial Operation (Q3-2019)
Total IESO-contracted embedded generation in commercial operation at end of each period.   Numbers may not add up to totals due to rounding.

1 A small amount (estimated 180 MW) of contracted embedded capacity is IESO-administered (market participant) generation and therefore reported in both grid-connected and contracted embedded generation totals.  Totals do not include non-contracted embedded generation capacity, whose total annual output is approximately 1 TWh.
Total Grid-Connected and Contracted Embedded Generation Capacity
Note: Numbers may not add up to totals due to rounding.
Quarter Generation Capacity (Grid-Connected) versus Ontario Demand and Operating Reserve (MW)
Ontario Operating Reserve Requirement at Peak
Note : Related reports can be found at http://reports.ieso.ca/public/Adequacy2 and http://reports.ieso.ca/public/Demand
Greenhouse Gas Emissions from the Ontario Electricity Sector

Note: Data to 2017 is as per Environment and Climate Change Canada's National Inventory Report issued in April 2019. Data for 2018 onwards is estimated by the IESO using actual energy production and emissions factors aligned with data provided by Environment and Climate Change Canada's National Inventory Report.
Air Contaminant Emissions from the Ontario Electricity Sector

Note: Data to 2017 is as reported to Environment and Climate Change Canada through the National Pollutant Release Inventory.  Data for 2018 onwards is estimated by the IESO using a combination of average historical data, actual energy production and facility level emissions factors (based on data reported to Environment and Climate Change Canada's National Pollutant Release Inventory).
These values to be posted in the December 19, 2019 Reliability Outlook
Note : Related reports can be found at http://reports.ieso.ca/public/Demand

Class A Historical Monthly Cost of Electricity (½/kWh)
1. Unweighted average of Hourly Ontario Energy Prices to reflect a typical (flat) industrial consumption profile.
2. Values may not add up to the total due to dollar values that are rounded down to cents
3. Related reports can be found at http://reports.ieso.ca/public/PriceHOEPAverage
Class B Historical Monthly Cost of Electricity (½/kWh)
1. Averages are weighted by the amount of electricity used throughout the province within each hour to broadly reflect the consumption profile of Class B(ie,. residential and commercial ) consumers.
2. Values may not add up to the total due to dollar values that are rounded down to cents
3. Related reports can be found at http://reports.ieso.ca/public/PriceHOEPAverage
